admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
trustfund:
TF056574-PHRD-SERBIA AND MONTENEGRO:
            SECOND PROGRAMMATIC PRIVATE AND FINANCIAL D

abstracts.cdata!:
This program document presents the first
            in the series of up to three Programmatic Private and
            Financial Development Policy Loans (PFDPLs) to the Republic
            of Serbia to support the government's structural reform
            program. The objective of the PFDPLs is to support three
            policy areas: (i) further improve the business environment
            to encourage new business and to attract foreign direct
            investments (FDI); (ii) strengthen financial discipline by
            enhancing hard budget constraints in the enterprise sector
            through privatization or bankruptcy, of large Socially-Owned
            Enterprise (SOE), and the restructuring of public utilities;
            and (iii) build a more efficient and stable financial sector
            through continuing the divestment of state ownership in the
            banking and insurance sectors, enhancing prudential
            supervision of banking and encouraging development of the
            capital markets.  The PFDPL is designed to support the
            government in advancing its financial and private sector
            related reforms. It is envisioned to be complemented by
            another Development Policy Loan (DPL) operation aimed at
            supporting Serbia's public expenditure management. The
            policy actions set in the PFDPL program will largely
            conclude the era of fast-track transition reforms in private
            and financial sectors of the Serbian economy. The private
            and financial sector reforms outside the PFDPL context will
            require a shift from immediate, near-term needs to medium-
            and longer-term results.
